page.title: 10THE ELDERLY IN WILLINGDON
page.content: Willingdon has a large proportion of elderly residents. Reasons expressed for living here include its situation in the South of England (for its climate) and its closeness to Eastbourne. Old people living alone tend to visit Church Halls and similar venues for leisure activities. Watching entertainments seems to be preferred to active participation in a hobby. The Bernhard Baron Home in Polegate has about sixty residents. It was founded by a brewer and a stag in the forecourt came from the grounds of his home. Subsequently it was supported by a cigarette manufacturer. It is now run by Quakers.The residents have entertainments provided for them at the Home and appreciate its grounds for outdoor leisure.
